E. Mass. tornado warning ends, but severe storms hit

Thunderstorms have begun rolling across the state, threatening the region with heavy rain, 60-mile-per-hour winds, and quarter-sized hail. (Globe, 3:33 p.m.)

Mass. tax collections up $600m in FY12

A candlepin comeback?

The small-pin style of bowling that is part of New England lore has a loyal band of enthusiasts who are trying to bring it back into the mainstream.

There isn’t enough time to read all of the interesting books — and publishers just keep putting out more.

A boost from Boston
in Rwanda’s cancer fight

Butaro Hospital, the first cancer ward in rural East Africa, opened last week with a big helping of Boston medical know-how.

No way to avoid political ads on TV

From ­Labor Day to Election Day, there will be an unprecedented onslaught of political advertising.

Obama camp rallies base in red states

The campaign is building the party apparatus in states that have been traditionally Republican in an effort to make them eventually winnable for Democrats.
Opinion | Dan Shaughnessy

Another terrible outing for Jon Lester

The Red Sox lefthander’s season-long struggles — he’s 5-7 — continued with a loss to the White Sox, where he was lit up for six runs in only four innings.

Few rules for leaves like Romney’s

Mitt Romney, who left Bain Capital in 1999 to oversee the Olympics, was not the first top executive to take a leave of absence and almost certainly won’t be the last.
